content.question: A student measures the <math alttext="p H" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>pH</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of a <math alttext="0.0100 molar" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.0100</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>M</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> buffer solution made with <math alttext="H C l O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HClO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="N a C l O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>NaClO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown above. The <math alttext="p K sub a" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p</mtext><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="H C l O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HClO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is 7.40 at <math alttext="25 degrees Celsius " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn><mi>°</mi><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Based on this information, which of the following best compares the relative concentrations of <math alttext="C l O with a negative 1 charge" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mtext>ClO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="H C l O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>HClO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> in the buffer solution?

choices.label: <math alttext="the molar concentration of C l O with a negative 1 charge is equal to the molar concentration of H C l O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>ClO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>]</mo><mo>=</mo><mo>[</mo><mtext>HClO</mtext><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the molar concentration of C l O with a negative 1 charge is greater than the molar concentration of H C l O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>ClO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>]</mo><mo>></mo><mo>[</mo><mtext>HClO</mtext><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the molar concentration of C l O with a negative 1 charge is less than the molar concentration of H C l O " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>ClO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>]</mo><mo><</mo><mo>[</mo><mtext>HClO</mtext><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

It is not possible to compare the concentrations without knowing the <math alttext="p K sub b" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>p</mtext><msub><mrow><mi>K</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>b</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="C l O with a negative 1 charge" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtext>ClO</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></math>.

content.answer: <math alttext="the molar concentration of C l O with a negative 1 charge is greater than the molar concentration of H C l O" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>[</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>ClO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>]</mo><mo>></mo><mo>[</mo><mtext>HClO</mtext><mo>]</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Make observations or collect data from representations of laboratory setups or results, while attending to precision where appropriate.
